isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - Meritor Medium Duty Front Drive Steer Axle - Assembly and Installation - Assemble Spindle, Brake Assembly and Dust Shield to Steering Knuckle

svcproc.title: Assemble Spindle, Brake Assembly and Dust Shield to Steering Knuckle

step1.para: On units equipped for ABS, if the steel sleeve for holding the ABS sensor clip and ABS sensor has been disassembled, install the sleeve with a suitable driver. Install the sleeve into the spindle until it is 15/16-inch (0.9375-inch or 23.8 mm) below the inner bearing shoulder. Install the ABS sensor clip in the sleeve (Figure 43).
If removed, install a new camshaft bearing and grease seals in the knuckle.
Pack the spindle bushing with grease.
If disassembled, install the bushing and grease seal into the spindle (Figure 43).
Install the spindle against the knuckle with the keyway slot for the wheel bearing adjusting nut system toward the top for ABS spindles (Figure 44).
Install the brake assembly onto the spindle. Fasten all parts to the knuckle with 12 capscrews and washers. Tighten to the correct torque specified in the Fastener Torque Chart (Figure 45).
On units equipped for ABS, install the ABS cable into the knuckle. Install the ABS sensor into the ABS bushing in the spindle.
If removed, install the stop screw to the depth marked during removal.

note.para: If the cam brakes need to be serviced, refer to Meritor Maintenance Manual 4, Cam-Master® Cam Brakes.
